episodes.original_body:
Case: Taylor-Thompson-MVA-12-06-2024
Client: Taylor Thompson

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Taylor Thompson
DOA November or december of 2024.
Son was the driver
Went to Aptiva
Went to hospital
Client has a loan from a legal lender
Has an 18k offer, turned it down and then client went to jail ( was repped by Morgan and Morgan)

Attorney John smith with Morgan and Morgan
502-741-6431

Mom’s number: 502-640-2363

DOB 7/8/1992

Had Medicaid 
__Person Making Contact:__ Justin
__Date & Time__: September 22 2025
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on September 22, 2025, with Justin regarding the motor vehicle accident case Taylor-Thompson-MVA-12-06-2024. The client is Taylor Thompson, born July 8, 1992, and the DOA is listed as November or December 2024. The client reports that her son was the driver in the incident. Following the crash, they went to Aptiva and then to a hospital. The client also notes that she has a loan from a legal lender. There was an $18,000 offer in the matter, which Taylor Thompson declined, after which she subsequently went to jail.

The client is represented by Attorney John Smith of Morgan & Morgan, who can be reached at 502-741-6431. The mother’s contact number is 502-640-2363. The record notes that Taylor Thompson had Medicaid at the time. The person making contact was Justin, and the contact date/time is September 22, 2025.
episodes.author: Filevine Integration

about.relevance: client's insurer at time of incident

episodes.original_body:
Case: Taylor-Thompson-MVA-12-06-2024
Client: Taylor Thompson

Aptiva has agreed to accept ($5,397.50) a 50% reduction on bill
Client has "loans" from a company named "Claims Angel" in the amount of $6,537.05
Current and what appears to be LBF is 18k
Indiana MVA so no PIP
episodes.natural_language: Initial client contact on December 6, 2024, with Taylor Thompson regarding a motor vehicle accident in Indiana. Aptiva has agreed to accept a $5,397.50 reduction on the bill, representing a 50% reduction. The client has "loans" from a company named "Claims Angel" in the amount of $6,537.05. The current and what appears to be LBF is $18,000. This is an Indiana motor vehicle accident, so there is no PIP (Personal Injury Protection).
episodes.author: Justin Chumbley

about.relevance: initial client contact (involved in motor vehicle accident)
agreed to accept a $5,397.50 bill reduction (50%)

Case Taylor-Thompson-MVA-12-06-2024 centers on client Taylor Thompson.

The record contains a message from Justin, of the Whaley Law Firm, addressed to Kathy: "Kathy, It's Justin from the Whaley Law Firm. I have had zero luck obtaining a copy of Taylor's file from Morgan and Morgan. Any assistance you can provide would be appreciated." He is requesting any assistance Kathy can provide in obtaining the file from Morgan and Morgan.
